author: Julia Shapero
description: President Trump on Monday signed an executive order establishing the Genesis Mission, a new endeavor to expand AI resources for scientific research.  The Genesis Mission, which the administration is comparing to the Apollo program that sent Americans to the moon in the late 1960s, seeks to create an integrated AI platform that brings together federal datasets, computing resources and AI tools to boost scientific discovery.  “Since the 1990s, America’s scientific edge…
title: Trump signs order creating Genesis Mission to boost AI-driven research

author: Max Rego
description: Sen. Ed Markey (D-Mass.) holds a 9-point edge over Rep. Seth Moulton (D-Mass.) in a new poll of likely Democratic primary voters, but more than a third of respondents are still undecided.  Markey, a progressive, garnered support from 34 percent of respondents in November’s Bay State Poll, a States of Opinion Project released on Monday…
title: Markey leads Moulton by 9 points for Senate, but with a third undecided: Poll

author: The Associated Press
description: Her grandson said Monday that she died surrounded by family at a Tulsa hospital.
title: Viola Ford Fletcher, one of the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre’s last survivors, dies at 111

author: Filip Timotija
description: The United States Naval Academy fired the commandant of midshipmen, Capt. Gilbert Clark Jr., on Monday due to a “loss of confidence in his ability to effectively lead” the brigade, removing him than his position less than half a year after he assumed the post. Clark, who assumed the role in June, was axed by…
title: US Naval Academy fires commandant less than 6 months into role

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Nearly 20 million people are projected to travel by air this week as officials brace for what some expect to be the busiest Thanksgiving travel week in 15 years. The Department of Transportation on Monday released its 2025 Thanksgiving week flight forecast, showing 19.3 million people projected to take flights in the seven-day period starting…
title: TSA expected to screen 19.3M travelers this week

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: If Stephen A. Smith is not planning a run for president anytime soon, he’s doing his best impersonation of a buzzworthy politician in the meantime. “I’m not ruling anything out, but I’m not thinking about that right now,” Smith told The Hill during an exclusive interview last week. “I love what I do, and I’m…
title: Stephen A. Smith eyes ‘profound impact’ on politics, not ruling out 2028 run

author: Brett Samuels
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said Monday the Department of Justice (DOJ) will appeal a federal judge’s decision to dismiss the criminal cases against former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James. Leavitt pushed back on the ruling from U.S. District Judge Cameron Currie, who said Lindsey Halligan, the U.S. attorney…
title: Leavitt pushes back on Comey, James case dismissals, vows DOJ appeal

author: Max Rego
description: Sens. Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) and Richard Blumenthal (D-Conn.) sent a letter to regulators on Saturday, requesting an investigation into Meta for allegedly profiting from fraudulent advertisements.  The letter, sent to Federal Trade Commission (FTC) Chair Andrew Ferguson and Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Paul Atkins, calls on their agencies to “investigate and, if appropriate,…
title: Senators call for investigation into Facebook, Instagram scam ads

author: Tara Suter
description: Former 2020 presidential candidate Andrew Yang said Monday that New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani (D) “had the right approach” for meeting President Trump recently. “If you’re going to deliver for the people of New York, you need to try and have a good relationship with the White House, you know, politics notwithstanding,” Yang said…
title: Mamdani ‘had the right approach’ for meeting Trump: Andrew Yang

author: Al Weaver
description: Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) on Monday said he will not be intimidated by the Pentagon’s investigation into “serious allegations of misconduct” against him after he called for U.S. military service members to disobey any illegal orders handed down by the Trump administration. Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth earlier in the day announced the Pentagon would…
title: Kelly to Hegseth: Pentagon investigation over ‘illegal orders’ video won’t ‘intimidate me’

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: These two men actually have more in common than either camp would admit.
title: Trump heaps praise on Mamdani during meeting: hope for US politics?

author: Rachel Frazin
description: President Trump is exempting coal used in steelmaking from Biden-era Clean Air Act regulations for two years. Trump on Friday issued a proclamation exempting facilities known as coke ovens from a rule limiting their releases of pollutants, such as mercury, formaldehyde, soot and dioxins. Coke ovens are chambers where coal is heated to produce coke, which is a fuel…
title: Trump exempts coal used in steelmaking from Clean Air Act regulation

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Offer Vince Shlomi, commonly known as the “ShamWow guy” after his series of towel infomercials, is running for a House seat in Texas with a pitch to “soak up the swamp,” according to primary filing information from the Texas GOP. Shlomi — a former fixture on American infomercials where he hawked “ShamWow” towels, which he touted…
title: ‘ShamWow’ guy running for Texas House seat

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Location, location, location. That’s what matters now on X, because Elon Musk has just rolled out a hugely important new feature, and it’s confirming what some of us have suspected was the case for some time now.  It turns out that many of the openly racist and anti-Semitic accounts on X that claim to be…
title: Elon Musk exposes real foreign racists with based new X feature

author: Bernard Goldberg, opinion contributor
description: Donald Trump defended Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for the murder of Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi, saying "things happen", which was seen as a line of decency being crossed.
title: Crossing the line in American politics

author: Julia Shapero
description: Sen. Ed Markey (D-Mass.) on Monday pressed President Trump for details about a deal to keep TikTok available in the U.S.  Markey underscored that few specifics have emerged since Trump signed an executive order in September approving the deal that would see the app spun off into a separate U.S. entity.  The agreement, which Treasury…
title: Senate Democrat asks Trump for TikTok divestiture details

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday spoke with Chinese President Xi Jinping, where the two leaders discussed trade, the war in Ukraine and plans for Trump to visit Beijing next spring. The call came roughly a month after Trump and Xi met in South Korea and reached agreements around tariffs, soybean purchases from U.S. farmers and curbing…
title: Trump speaks with Xi, says he’ll visit China in April

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.) raised concerns over President Trump accusing six Democratic lawmakers of sedition for telling service members they can disobey illegal orders.  Speaking to reporters on Friday, the New York Democrat said the president’s remarks “indicate a level of instability” that “we should be all be questioning right now, whether that’s emotional, mental,…
title: Ocasio-Cortez: Trump ‘traitors’ remarks show ‘level of instability’

author: Ella Lee
description: A federal judge on Monday dismissed the cases against two of President Trump’s political adversaries after finding that the prosecutor Trump handpicked to pursue charges against them was unlawfully appointed. U.S. District Judge Cameron Currie said that Lindsey Halligan, the U.S. attorney selected by Trump to prosecute former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney…
title: Judge dismisses DOJ criminal cases against Comey, James

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has brought back everyone who it laid off during the government shutdown, a top official told a California federal court Friday.  The agency’s Office of Human Resources on Nov. 17 emailed the 954 employees who received “reduction in force” notices during the shutdown informing them that those…
title: HHS officially rescinds shutdown layoffs

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Trump administration is pushing back on reporting that the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) commission dissolved months before its charter was set to expire. In a post on the social platform X, Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Director Scott Kupor took aim at Reuters, criticizing the news agency for quoting him saying, “That doesn’t…
title: OPM pushes back on report DOGE dissolved ahead of schedule

author: Filip Timotija
description: The Pentagon said Monday that it has received “serious allegations of misconduct” against Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) and has initiated a “thorough review” of the allegations. It comes days after the senator, along with a handful of other lawmakers, called on U.S. service members to disobey any illegal orders issued by the Trump administration.  The…
title: Pentagon launches review of ‘serious allegations of misconduct’ against Mark Kelly

author: Harlan Ullman, opinion contributor
description: One area in particular is in the worst of times: the political environment in which both sides cannot agree on common sense governing.
title: The best and worst of times and America’s political divide

author: Ella Lee
description: A federal appeals court panel seems likely to side with President Trump in his battle with The Associated Press, paving the way for the president to exile reporters from key White House spaces if he disagrees with their opinions.  The three-judge panel on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit heard spirited arguments…
title: Appeals panel seems likely to side with Trump in clampdown on AP access

author: Steven Lubet, opinion contributor
description: Trump got the Supreme Court’s message that he needn’t exercise “undue caution.”
title: Thanks to the Supreme Court, presidential immunity is now a license to kill

author: Rachel Frazin
description: Countries around the world have agreed to put more money toward fighting climate change as this year’s COP30 climate summit concludes in Brazil. A formal decision released over the weekend said the nations will seek to mobilize at least $1.3 trillion per year by 2035 to help developing countries with the issue. While climate change is a…
title: Nations seek to put more money toward fighting climate change in COP30 decision

author: Filip Timotija
description: The U.S. top military officer is visiting Puerto Rico on Monday for the second time this year to meet with service members of the U.S. Southern Command (Southcom), where the administration has established a massive military presence and as President Trump weighs military action against Venezuela.  The chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Gen.…
title: Top US military officer visits Puerto Rico amid pressure on Venezuela

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump’s approval on the economy is down 15 points since March, according to a new CBS News/YouGov survey. The poll, conducted late last week, shows 36 percent of Americans approve of Trump’s handling of the economy, down from 51 percent in a poll released in early March. The drop in economic approval is more…
title: Trump approval on economy off 15 points since March: Poll

author: Max Rego
description: Multiple international airlines have canceled flights to Venezuela in the wake of the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) advising pilots to exercise caution while flying in its airspace.  Six carriers have indefinitely suspended flights, according to Marisela de Loaiza, the president of the Airlines Association in Venezuela: TAP, LATAM, Avianca, Iberia, Gol and Caribbean. Turkish Airlines,…
title: Airlines cancel flights to Venezuela after FAA warning

author: Svante Myrick, opinion contributor
description: For me, Trump 2.0 certainly qualifies as a hard time.
title: Gratitude for good things in hard times

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump on Monday suggested that an end to Russia’s more than three-years-long war in Ukraine is in sight after Secretary of State Marco Rubio led talks in Geneva over the weekend. “Is it really possible that big progress is being made in Peace Talks between Russia and Ukraine???” Trump wrote in a post on his Truth…
title: Live updates: Trump teases ‘good progress’ on Russia-Ukraine war peace plan

author: Max Rego
description: European officials expressed optimism regarding talks Sunday between the U.S. and Ukraine regarding the Trump administration’s peace proposal to end the war with Russia. Finnish President Alexander Stubb said on the social platform X that “steps were taken toward a just and lasting peace” in Geneva.  “There are still unresolved issues. It is clear that…
title: European officials see progress in Ukraine peace talks

author: Douglas E. Schoen and Carly Cooperman, opinion contributors
description: If the midterms were tomorrow, Democrats would likely win, and win big. Indeed, a slew of new polls suggests that the 2026 midterms may resemble 2018, when Democrats gained a historic 41 House seats. Democrats lead by 14 points (55 percent to 41 percent) in a generic congressional election per PBS/NPR/Marist polling, their largest advantage in…
title: For Democrats, 2026 is shaping up to be 2018 part two

author: Brett Samuels
description: The Trump administration is designating Venezuela’s Cartel de los Soles as a foreign terrorist organization, the latest measure to ramp up pressure on President Nicolás Maduro. The State Department formally announced the designation in the Federal Register on Monday, giving the Trump administration additional tools to go after the cartel. Cartel de los Soles, or…
title: Trump administration designates Maduro-linked group foreign terrorist organization

author: The Associated Press
description: A Wisconsin woman who admitted to nearly stabbing a classmate to death at age 12 to please the online horror character Slender Man has been found in Illinois after she cut off an electronic monitoring device and left a group home, authorities said.
title: Woman in Slender Man stabbing is found day after walking away from group home

author: John Bolton, opinion contributor
description: “Friendly” proliferation jeopardizes not just our alliances, but America itself.
title: Trump’s isolationism is speeding up ‘friendly’ nuclear proliferation

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Democrats are going all in on a Tennessee special election next month, teeing up one last test of their electoral strength ahead of 2026 after enjoying a string of victories in November.   Former Vice President Harris and Democratic National Committee (DNC) Chair Ken Martin in recent weeks have campaigned for Democrat Aftyn Behn, a…
title: Democrats look to cap off winning streak with Tennessee special election

author: Alexander Bolton
description: GOP lawmakers are growing increasingly concerned over signs that the 2026 midterm elections could be a wipeout for Republicans that could cost them control of the House and shave down their Senate majority by two or three seats. Republican senators say the off-year elections in New Jersey, Virginia and other parts of the country on Nov. 4 served…
title: Republican lawmakers grow alarmed over signs of 2026 election wipeout

description: The fight over who will lead the University of Virginia (UVA) has now drawn in the Trump administration and both the current and future governors of the state.   After former UVA President James Ryan released a 12-page letter last week alleging some on the school’s board worked with the Trump Justice Department to force…
title: UVA struggles to shake political upheaval as it hunts for new leader

author: Tara Suter
description: Most Americans are against military action in Venezuela after recent tension in the region, according to a new poll from CBS News/YouGov. In the poll, 70 percent said they were against “the U.S. taking military action in Venezuela,” while 30 percent said they were for it. The U.S. military has recently bolstered its presence near…
title: Most Americans oppose military action in Venezuela: Poll

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump on Sunday said the GOP “has never been so united” after recent tension between himself and some members of the party. “The Republican Party has never been so UNITED AS IT iS RIGHT NOW!” the president said in a post on his Truth Social platform. “Other than Rand Paul, Rand Paul Jr.(Massie!), Marjorie…
title: Trump: ‘Republican Party has never been so united’
